extendedIngredients.name: berries
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups ripe berries, such as blueberries, raspberries and/or chopped strawberries
metaInformation: such as blueberries, raspberries and/or chopped strawberries

extendedIngredients.name: cantaloupe
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ ripe medium cantaloupe, cut into ½-inch dice

extendedIngredients.name: green grapes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ½ cups small green seedless grapes

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
nectarines
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 ripe peaches or nectarines, pitted and cut into ½-inch dice

extendedIngredients.name: soy yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups low-fat vanilla yogurt or vanilla-flavored soy yogurt

extendedIngredients.name: white grape juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ½ cups white grape juice or as needed

recipes.title: Fruity Vanilla Dessert Soup
recipes.instructions: In large glass or ceramic bowl, mix yogurt and ginger until blended. Add berries, watermelon, grapes, peaches and cantaloupe and stir gently to coat. Stir in enough grape juice to achieve slightly thick dressing consistency. If mixture isn’t sweet enough, add honey to your liking. Serve right away or cover and refrigerate up to 2 hours. Stir before serving.

steps.step: In large glass or ceramic bowl, mix yogurt and ginger until blended.

Add berries, watermelon, grapes, peaches and cantaloupe and stir gently to coat. Stir in enough grape juice to achieve slightly thick dressing consistency. If mixture isn’t sweet enough, add honey to your liking.
Serve right away or cover and refrigerate up to 2 hours. Stir before serving.
